intro: Tabebuia monticola, commonly known as the mountain trumpet tree, is a tropical flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The tree typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its bark is often used in traditional medicine, and it is valued for its ornamental beauty and ability to provide shade in tropical landscapes. The plant also plays an important ecological role by supporting local wildlife and contributing to biodiversity.
